Name: Rendering
Description: Raw data visualization features required for quality map composition

Name: Hardware acceleration
Description: The library can utilize the GPU for faster rendering
Addendum: OpenLayers’ support is partial, lines and polygons need additional setup. In Cesium and Maplibre, everything is hardware-accelerated. For Leaflet, you can try Leaflet.glify.

Name: Render geometry
Description: The library can render vector geometries

Name: Render raster
Description: The library can render raster layers
Addendum: Leaflet can render GeoTIFFs easily with the leaflet-geotiff plugin.

Name: Render image
Description: The library can render image files

Name: Blend layers
Description: The library can overlay different layers using different blending modes
Addendum: Support in OpenLayers only applies to layers displayed with the canvas renderer.

Name: Format
Description: Data exchange format support used in GIS software

Name: Vector
Description: Vector data exchange format support

Name: ESRI Shapefile
Description: The library can read Shapefiles
Addendum: There are third-party JavaScript libraries for interpreting Shapefiles.

Name: KML
Description: The library can read KMLs
Addendum: Possible with plugins in Leaflet and Maplibre GL JS.

Name: GeoJSON
Description: The library can read GeoJSONs

Name: WFS
Description: The library can read vector data through a WFS connection
Addendum: Easy to manually implement as long as the map can tell its exact view bounds and the WFS server can speak GeoJSON.

Name: Write transaction
Description: The library can write vector data through a WFS-T connection

Name: Mapbox vector tile
Description: The library can read Mapbox vector tiles

Name: Raster
Description: Raster data exchange format support

Name: GeoTiff
Description: The library can read GeoTIFF rasters
Addendum: Needs geotiff.js in every case. In OpenLayers it is bundled with the library.

Name: Arc/Info ASCII GRID
Description: The library can read ASCII rasters

Name: WCS
Description: The library can read raster data through a WCS connection

Name: Image
Description: Image data exchange format support

Name: JPEG
Description: The library can read JPEG images

Name: PNG
Description: The library can read PNG images

Name: WMS
Description: The library can read images through a WMS connection

Name: Tile service
Description: Tiled image data exchange format support

Name: WMTS
Description: The library can read tiles through a WMTS connection

Name: TMS
Description: The library can read tiles through a TMS connection

Name: Slippy map
Description: The library can read tiles served in an OpenStreetMap Slippy map format

Name: Google Maps
Description: The library can read Google Maps layers
Addendum: Cesium’s support focuses on photorealistic 3D tiles with 3D objects.

Name: ArcGIS REST API
Description: The library can read ArcGIS Online layers

Name: Bing Maps
Description: The library can read Bing Maps layers

Name: Database
Description: The ability to communicate with spatial databases

Name: Connection
Description: Connecting to spatial databases

Name: PostGIS
Description: The library can connect to PostGIS databases

Name: SpatiaLite
Description: The library can connect to SpatiaLite databases
Addendum: There is a GeoPackage JavaScript library for this.

Name: MySQL
Description: The library can connect to MySQL databases

Name: Functionality
Description: Basic database functionality

Name: Using DBMS
Description: The library can use any DBMS for vector data
Addendum: Possible with a custom IndexedDB vector type.

Name: Query/filter
Description: The library is capable of querying and filtering vector data

Name: Query language
Description: The library can use a query language to query and filter vector data
Addendum: Possible with a custom IndexedDB vector type.

Name: Data
Description: Data operations

Name: Pre-process
Description: Processing capabilities for organizing and manipulating data before display

Name: On the fly transformation
Description: The library is capable to project vector data on the fly

Name: Read attribute data
Description: The library can use vector attributes

Name: Z, and M coordinates
Description: The library preserves Z and M coordinates in vectors
Addendum: Maplibre GL JS and Cesium JS utilize Z coordinates, but do not support measurement coordinates.

Name: Geometry types
Description: The library can interpret the basic geometry types of points, lines, polygons, and their multipart counterparts

Name: Spatial indexing
Description: The library is capable to apply a spatial index on its internal vector layers to speed up processing and display
Addendum: Leaflet can use the Leaflet.LayerIndex plugin for this.

Name: Geometry validation
Description: The library can validate vector geometries and identify invalid ones
Addendum: There are geoprocessing libraries for this purpose (e.g. Turf, JSTS).

Name: Geometry simplification
Description: The library is capable of generalizing vector geometries on the fly

Name: Attribute table
Description: The library is capable of organizing vector attributes into an attribute table
Addendum: The organizing part is quite trivial to do manually, but for the tabular display an external library is recommended.

Name: Conversion
Description: Data type conversion support

Name: Interpolate
Description: The library can interpolate vector data into a raster layer
Addendum: If we consider heatmap visualization as a form of interpolation.

Name: Raster to vector
Description: The library can vectorize raster data

Name: Vector to raster
Description: The library can rasterize vector data

Name: Manipulation
Description: Capabilities for raw vector data and layer management

Name: Update attribute data
Description: The library can write attribute data of vector layers on the fly

Name: Update geometry
Description: The library can update geometries of vector layers on the fly

Name: Field calculator
Description: The library has an abstract mechanism for calculating attributes
Addendum: Maplibre GL JS and OpenLayers have data-driven styling.

Name: Add/remove layer
Description: The library can add and remove layers

Name: Change layer order
Description: The library is capable of changing the visual order of layers
Addendum: Maplibre GL JS does not have a traditional concept of layers. You can reorder features based on attributes with some code.

Name: Typed layers
Description: The library has a type system for its layers

Name: Analysis
Description: Complex data manipulation capabilities

Name: Basic geoprocessing
Description: The library can do basic vector operations (clip, dissolve, buffer, union, difference)
Addendum: There are geoprocessing libraries for this purpose (e.g. Turf, JSTS).

Name: Topological analysis
Description: The library can do vector operations based on topology (intersect, touch, within, cross)
Addendum: There are geoprocessing libraries for this purpose (e.g. Turf, JSTS).

Name: Modify image
Description: The library is capable to transform image data

Name: Modify raster
Description: The library is capable to transform raster data

Name: Raster algebra
Description: The library is capable of executing matrix operations between multiple raster layers
Addendum: Only works in OpenLayers with image layers using an ol/source/Raster source, not with GeoTIFF rasters.

Name: Classification
Description: The library can reclassify raster layers
Addendum: Only works in OpenLayers with image layers using an ol/source/Raster source, not with GeoTIFF rasters.

Name: Convolution
Description: The library can transform rasters with a convolution matrix (moving window)
Addendum: Only works in OpenLayers with image layers using an ol/source/Raster source, not with GeoTIFF rasters.

Name: Write WPS request
Description: The library is capable of requesting spatial operations through a WPS connection

Name: Projection
Description: Projection handling

Name: Transform vector
Description: The library can transform geometries between known projections

Name: Warp raster
Description: The library can transform raster and image layers between known projections

Name: Well-known projections
Description: The library can use WG84 (EPSG:4326) and Web Mercator (EPSG:3857) projections
Addendum: Maplibre GL JS can currently only use Web Mercator, but supporting multiple projections is under consideration by the development team.

Name: Custom projections
Description: The library can use well-defined custom projections
Addendum: The Proj4JS library is required in every case.

Name: Interaction
Description: GUI capabilities

Name: Draw features
Description: Users can digitize vector features in this library
Addendum: Draw functions in Maplibre GL JS use the mapbox-gl-draw plugin, which currently mostly works, but is susceptible to break when the source codes of Maplibre and Mapbox drift apart far enough.

Name: Modify features
Description: Users can modify features with a mouse-based tool in this library

Name: Snap points
Description: The library is capable of snapping vertices

Name: Modify view
Description: The library is capable to change its view settings (e.g. projection) on the fly

Name: Select features
Description: Users can select features with a mouse-based tool in this library

Name: Query
Description: Users can query features using the GUI in this library

Name: Measure
Description: Users can measure lengths and areas with a mouse-based tool in this library

Name: Change time
Description: The library offers temporal controls to users

Name: Mouse coordinates
Description: The library can display mouse coordinates

Name: Representation
Description: Thematic data visualization capabilities

Name: Styling
Description: Features required for creating thematic map content

Name: Style vector
Description: The library is capable of applying different styles to vector elements

Name: Style raster
Description: The library is capable of applying different styles to raster layers

Name: Thematic maps
Description: The library can change its applied styles dynamically

Name: Cartographic elements
Description: Features required for creating a map

Name: Scale bar
Description: The library can display a scale bar

Name: North arrow
Description: The library can display a North arrow

Name: Legend
Description: The library can display a legend for its layers
Addendum: Some libraries have layer switcher plugins, but creating a full-fledged legend with styles, categories and labels is always a challenge.

Name: Graticule
Description: The library can display a graticule over the map

Name: Text box
Description: The library can display overlays

Name: Overview map
Description: The library can display an inset map for making orientation and navigation easier
Addendum: You can always create and synchronize a second map instance, if everything else fails.
